{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the documents, the World Health Organization (WHO) defines anemia in pregnancy based on the trimester. In the first trimester, anemia is diagnosed when hemoglobin is less than 11 g/dL. In the second trimester, it's less than 10.5 g/dL, and in the third trimester, it's less than 11 g/dL. Therefore, the closest answer to the WHO's definition of anemia in pregnancy is when hemoglobin is less than 11.0 gm%.", "answer_choice": "B"}
